channel.title: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet
channel.description: Is it possible to get an onion hidden service, host from own PC and make it accessable to the clearnet users? There was a recommendation to use pagekite trick but pagekite requires payment. Are there fully free-of-charge ways?

item.title: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Retroshare is not a candidate for being installed by default. As per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Default_Application_Policy. Not installable from Debian.

I don’t want to have lots of private chats on TorChat. Time is not unlimited.

Read full topic
item.source: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet

item.title: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet
item.dc:creator: atari
item.description:
Let’s go with a decentralized solution like torchat or retroshare. By the way you can publish your torchat id in your contact info. It would promote torchat use. And retroshare for support channel. Also we could share files.

Read full topic
item.source: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet

item.title: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Not that I know.

Also why not make channel at freenode, that oftc has not been accessible for weeks.
Being discussed here: https://phabricator.whonix.org/T361

Read full topic
item.source: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet

item.title: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet
item.dc:creator: atari
item.description:
There is one possible solution. You can get free domain address at https://freedns.afraid.org/
Then suppose i decide to host on own pc. Can i route via some tor-to-clearnet site my onion site to that freedns domain name that i register at afraid.org?
Also why not make channel at freenode, that oftc has not been accessible for weeks.

Read full topic
item.source: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet

item.title: Free of charge web site with access from the clearnet
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Not that I know. The overview can be found here:

Whonix

Hosting Location Hidden Services

Anonymous Hosting, Comparison Table of Tor Onion Services, VPN with Remote Port Forwarding, pagekite and Anonymous Third Party Hosts

Read full topic
